doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.label:
Enter window size (value from 1 to 100)?
The values of melting point and other thermodynamic properties of the sequence are determined by taking a short length of sequence known as a window and determining the properties of the sequence in that window. The window is incrementally moved along the sequence with the properties being calculated at each new position.

Enter shift increment (value greater than or equal to 1)?
This is the amount by which the window is moved at each increment in order to find the melting point and other properties along the sequence.
Enter dna concentration (nm) (value from 1. to 100000.)
Enter salt concentration (mm) (value from 1. to 1000.)

Prompt for product values?
Yes No
This prompts for percent formamide, percent of mismatches allowed and product length.

Enter percentage of formamide (value from 0. to 100.)?
This specifies the percent formamide to be used in calculations (it is ignored unless -product is used).

Enter percent mismatch (value from 0. to 100.)?
This specifies the percent mismatch to be used in calculations (it is ignored unless -product is used).

Enter the product length?
This specifies the product length to be used in calculations (it is ignored unless -product is used).

Thermodynamic calculations?
Yes No
Output the DeltaG, DeltaH and DeltaS values of the sequence windows to the output data file.

Enter temperature (value from 0. to 100.)?
If -thermo has been specified then this specifies the temperature at which to calculate the DeltaG, DeltaH and DeltaS values.

Use rna data values?
Yes No
This specifies that the sequence is an RNA sequence and not a DNA sequence.

Produce a plot?
Yes No
If this is not specified then the file of output data is produced, else a plot of the melting point along the sequence is produced.

Enter minimum temperature (value from 0. to 150.)?
Enter a minimum value for the temperature scale (y-axis) of the plot.
Choose the e_graph output format Png Gif Cps Ps Meta Data
Name of the output graph

Name of the report file?
If a plot is not being produced then data on the melting point etc. in each window along the sequence is output to the file.
Choose the report output format Dasgff Dbmotif Diffseq Embl Excel Feattable Genbank Gff Listfile Motif Nametable Codata Regions Seqtable Simple Srs Swiss Table Tagseq

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The values of melting point and other thermodynamic properties of the sequence are determined by taking a short length of sequence known as a window and determining the properties of the sequence in that window. The window is incrementally moved along the sequence with the properties being calculated at each new position.
This is the amount by which the window is moved at each increment in order to find the melting point and other properties along the sequence.
This prompts for percent formamide, percent of mismatches allowed and product length.
This specifies the percent formamide to be used in calculations (it is ignored unless -product is used).
This specifies the percent mismatch to be used in calculations (it is ignored unless -product is used).
This specifies the product length to be used in calculations (it is ignored unless -product is used).
Output the DeltaG, DeltaH and DeltaS values of the sequence windows to the output data file.
If -thermo has been specified then this specifies the temperature at which to calculate the DeltaG, DeltaH and DeltaS values.
This specifies that the sequence is an RNA sequence and not a DNA sequence.
If this is not specified then the file of output data is produced, else a plot of the melting point along the sequence is produced.
Enter a minimum value for the temperature scale (y-axis) of the plot.
If a plot is not being produced then data on the melting point etc. in each window along the sequence is output to the file.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

format.code: ("", " -windowsize=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 1 is required
Value less than or equal to 100 is required

comment.text: The values of melting point and other thermodynamic properties of the sequence are determined by taking a short length of sequence known as a window and determining the properties of the sequence in that window. The window is incrementally moved along the sequence with the properties being calculated at each new position.
